member.name: T:System.Net.WebSockets.MessageReceivedEventHandler
member.summary: Describes the method that will handle the event that's fired when a message that has been subscribed to has been received.
member.param: The proximity device that received the message.
The proximity device that received the message.

member.summary: Option for SSL verification. The default behavior is .

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.ClientWebSocket.CACertificate
member.summary: Gets or sets the root CA certificate used to authenticate with secure servers. This certificate is used only for wss connections; ws connections do not require this.

member.summary: Option to use the certificate stored in the device as client or server certificate. The default option is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the TLS/SSL protocol used by the class.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket
member.summary: The WebSocket class allows applications to send and receive data after the WebSocket upgrade has completed.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.IsServer
member.summary: to indicate it's the server-side of the connection; if it's the client-side.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.LastContactTimeStamp
member.summary: The UTC time of the last received message or Controller message

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.ServerTimeout
member.summary: The timeout which specifies how long to wait for a message before closing the connection. Default is 60 seconds.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.KeepAliveInterval
member.summary: The interval that the client will send keep alive messages to let the server know to not close the connection. Default is 30 second interval.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.MaxReceiveFrameSize
member.summary: Gets the maximum allowed byte length of messages received by the WebSocket .
member.value: The maximum allowed byte length of messages received by the WebSocket. Default is int.MaxValue.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.MaxFragmentSize
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum allowed byte length of a partial message send by the WebSocket. By default if a message that exceeds the size limit it will be broken up in smaller partial messages Default is 124 bytes
The maximum allowed byte length of a partial message send by the WebSocket.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.State
member.summary: Gets the WebSocket state of the System.Net.WebSockets.ClientWebSocket instance.
member.value: The WebSocket state of the System.Net.WebSockets.ClientWebSocket instance.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.MessageReceivedEventHandler
member.summary: Occurs when a message is received. Controller messages are handled internally and do not raise an event.
member.remarks: The WebSocket will stop to receive any incoming messages including controller messages until the provided ReceiveMessageStream is completely read till the end.

member.name: E:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.ConnectionClosed
member.summary: Occurs when the connection is closed. The connection could be closed due to an error or due to either the server or client intentionally closing the connection without error.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.RemoteEndPoint
member.summary: Gets the Remote Endpoint where the WebSocket connects to.
member.value: The Remote Endpoint where the WebSocket connects to.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.#ctor(System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketOptions)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket class.
member.param: Optional WebSocketOptions where extra options can be defined.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.ConnectToStream(System.Net.Sockets.NetworkStream,System.Boolean,System.Net.Sockets.Socket)
member.summary: Connects the WebSocket to the specified stream, which represents a web socket connection.
member.param: to indicate it's the server-side of the connection; if it's the client-side.
The socket on which the WebSocket connects to.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.Send(System.Byte[],System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketMessageType,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends data over the System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket connection.
member.param: The buffer containing the message content.
Indicates whether the application is sending a binary or text message.
Indicates whether the application is sending a binary or text message. Default -1 will use the maxFragmentSize
member.returns: if the message was successfully queued for send. otherwise.
member.remarks: Messages are buffered send synchronously using a single send thread. The send message is not awaited.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.SendString(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends a text message over the System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket connection.
member.param: The text that will be send
Indicates whether the application is sending a binary or text message. Default -1 will use the maxFragmentSize
member.returns: if the message was successfully queued for send. otherwise.
member.remarks: Messages are buffered send synchronously using a single send thread. The send message is not awaited.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.SendBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends a binary message over the System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket connection.
member.param: The binary data that will be send.
Indicates whether the application is sending a binary or text message. Default -1 will use the maxFragmentSize
member.returns: if the message was successfully queued for send. otherwise.
member.remarks: Messages are buffered send synchronously using a single send thread. The send message is not awaited.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.Close(System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketCloseStatus,System.String)
member.summary: Will start closing the WebSocket connection using the close handshake defined in the WebSocket protocol specification section 7.
member.param: Indicates the reason for closing the WebSocket connection.
Specifies a human readable explanation as to why the connection is closed.
member.remarks: WebSocketCloseStatus.EndpointUnavailable will close the WebSocket synchronous without awaiting response.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.Abort
member.summary: Aborts the WebSocket connection and cancels any pending IO operations.

member.name: E:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket.MessageReceived
member.summary: Event raised when a message is received by the WebSocket.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebSockets.FragmentationType
member.summary: Indicates the message Fragmentation Type.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.FragmentationType.NotFragmented
member.summary: The message is not fragmented.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.FragmentationType.FirstFragment
member.summary: Message Frame contains the first fragment of a fragmented message.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.FragmentationType.Fragment
member.summary: Message Frame contains a next fragment of the message.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.FragmentationType.FinalFragment
member.summary: Message frame contains the last fragment of the message.

member.summary: The base WebSocket Message frame.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.MessageFrame.EndPoint
member.summary: The Remote Endpoint from which the message is received.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.MessageFrame.MessageType
member.summary: Indicates whether the current message is a UTF-8 message or a binary message.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebSockets.ReceiveMessageFrame
member.summary: The Receive Message Frame

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.ReceiveMessageFrame.Fragmentation
member.summary: Indicates if the message is fragmented. And what fragment is received.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.ReceiveMessageFrame.IsFragmented
member.summary: Indicates if the message is fragmented.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.ReceiveMessageFrame.MessageLength
member.summary: The content length of the message in number of bytes.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.ReceiveMessageFrame.Buffer
member.summary: Buffer holding the message content.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketCloseStatus
member.summary: Represents well known WebSocket close codes as defined in section 11.7 of the WebSocket protocol spec.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketCloseStatus.ClosedAbnormally
member.summary: (1006) connection was closed abnormally - internal application use only

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketCloseStatus.NormalClosure
member.summary: (1000) The connection has closed after the request was fulfilled.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketCloseStatus.EndpointUnavailable
member.summary: (1001) Indicates an endpoint is being removed. Either the server or client will become unavailable.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketCloseStatus.ProtocolError
member.summary: (1002) The client or server is terminating the connection because of a protocol error.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketCloseStatus.InvalidMessageType
member.summary: (1003) The client or server is terminating the connection because it cannot accept the data type it received.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketCloseStatus.Reserved
member.summary: (1004) Reserved. The specific meaning might be defined in the future the data type it received.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketCloseStatus.Empty
member.summary: No error specified - internal application use only.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketCloseStatus.InvalidPayloadData
member.summary: (1007) The client or server is terminating the connection because it has received data inconsistent with the message type.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketCloseStatus.PolicyViolation
member.summary: (1008) The connection will be closed because an endpoint has received a message that violates its policy.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketCloseStatus.MessageTooBig
member.summary: (1009) The client or server is terminating the connection because it has received a message that is too big for it to process.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketCloseStatus.MandatoryExtension
member.summary: (1010) The client is terminating the connection because it expected the server to negotiate an extension.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketCloseStatus.InternalServerError
member.summary: (1011) The connection will be closed by the server because of an error on the server.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketMessageType
member.summary: Indicates the message type.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketMessageType.Text
member.summary: The message is clear text.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketMessageType.Binary
member.summary: The message is in binary format.

member.summary: Options to use with a ClientWebSocket object.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketOptions.KeepAliveInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the WebSocket protocol keep-alive interval.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketOptions.ServerTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the WebSocket timeout which specifies how long to wait for a message.
member.value: The WebSocket timeout which specifies how long to wait for a message.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketOptions.MaxReceiveFrameSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed byte length of messages received by the WebSocket .
member.value: The maximum allowed byte length of messages received by the WebSocket.

member.name: P:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketOptions.MaxFragmentSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed byte length of a partial message send by the WebSocket. By default if a message that exceeds the size limit it will be broken up in smaller partial messages
member.value: The maximum allowed byte length of a partial message send by the WebSocket.

member.name: T:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketState
member.summary: Defines the different states a WebSockets instance can be in.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketState.None
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketState.Connecting
member.summary: The connection is negotiating the handshake with the remote endpoint.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketState.Open
member.summary: The initial state after the HTTP handshake has been completed.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketState.CloseSent
member.summary: A close message was sent to the remote endpoint.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketState.CloseReceived
member.summary: A close message was received from the remote endpoint.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketState.Closed
member.summary: Indicates the WebSocket close handshake completed gracefully.

member.name: F:System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocketFrame.WebSocketState.Aborted
member.summary: Reserved for future use.
